feat.value: They said about Abba Paphnutius that he never hastens to drink wine.
But while walking on one occasion he came upon a band of bandits
and he found them drinking.
And he knew him, that is the one who is head,
and while knowing that he never drinks wine
he saw him in a great weariness
(and) filled a cup of wine
while his sword (is) in his hand
and told the old man
“If you don't drink I will kill you.”
He knew, that is, the old man, that it’s to do the commandment of God that he wants
and wanting to gain him
he took it (and) he drank it.
But the head of the bandits, he repented saying:
“forgive me my father for I have made you suffer”.
He said to him, that is the old man:
“I trust in God that he will do you charity for this cup of wine in this life and the one that’s coming”.
He said to him, that is the head-bandit:
“I trust in God that from now I won’t do wrong to anyone.”
And the old man, he acquired for himself the whole band,
for he left his desire behind him for God.
